programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: Mel Gibson stars as a Los Angeles policeman who recently lost his wife and has been acting increasingly unstable. Danny Glover plays a homicide detective with an impeccable record and a loving family. Now the two are stuck with each other as partners.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2
programme.desc: Mel Gibson and Danny Glover are back as a volatile pair of LAPD detectives. This time, the cops are unhappy with their assignment to baby-sit an accountant. But the mob wants the accountant dead—and is killing everyone who gets in its way.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 3
programme.desc: Police officers Riggs (Mel Gibson) and Murtaugh (Danny Glover) team for the third time. This time, they must track down a crooked cop who has stolen weapons from the Los Angeles police depot.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 4
programme.desc: Mel Gibson and Danny Glover reteam as a pair of Los Angeles police detectives. Promoted to desk jobs to keep them out of trouble, the two cops join forces with a junior detective and a fast-talking private investigator to unravel a series of crimes.

programme.title: Tears of the Sun
programme.desc: After a West African president's family is assassinated and civil unrest is rampant, a top-secret team is deployed to the far reaches of the jungle to rescue a U.S. doctor who is acting as a missionary.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: A crew of officers at an armored transport security firm embark on the ultimate heist – against their own company. The seemingly fool-proof plan soon proves to be useless when an unexpected witness interferes, as the plan quickly unravels.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible
programme.desc: Ethan Hunt, a secret agent, is framed for the deaths of his espionage team and attempts to flee government assassins after him. He races against the clock in order to discover the truth.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible II
programme.desc: The world's greatest spy, Ethan Hunt, returns and partners up with the beautiful Nyah Hall to stop renegade agent Sean Ambrose from releasing a new kind of terror on an unsuspecting world.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Colour
programme.desc: Color is essential to both art and astronomy. When measured, it can tell us the temperature, chemical composition, and motion of astronomical objects.

programme.title: Cosmic Vistas: Cosmic Perspective
programme.desc: For most of human history, the night sky seemed two-dimensional. To our ancestors, this perspective gave no hint to the universe's true depth.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: From living in caves to grand mansions, shelter has always been high on the list of priorities.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Examining the history of the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: Without water, civilization is simply not possible; Romans took control of their water seriously.

programme.title: Ancient Engineering
programme.desc: How gold is mined and transformed into everyday objects like jewelry and currency.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: The earth is 4.5 billion years old and it is slowly dying. Tectonic activity is slowly cooling the planet – the continents will eventually move together to form a new supercontinent called Pangea Ultima.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Naked Science investigates the violent cosmological forces that create planets and discover what it is that makes a planet a planet.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Almost every culture on Earth tells the story of an ancient flood – details vary but the basic plot is the same - An angry God wipes out an unrepentant population.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: The earth is 4.5 billion years old and it is slowly dying. Tectonic activity is slowly cooling the planet – the continents will eventually move together to form a new supercontinent called Pangea Ultima.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: The Hubble Telescope is nearing its end, the replacements are ready to go, ready to peer further back in time and space than can be imagined.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The next 12 months will see an intense rise in flight tests, demonstration launches and high priority flights. Some are on time others are not. We check the flight status of some of this new hardware and these new capabilities.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The next 12 months will see an intense rise in flight tests, demonstration launches and high priority flights. Some are on time others are not. We check the flight status of some of this new hardware and these new capabilities.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Cosmic Collisions
programme.desc: Space is vast, yet it is full of collisions. Gas and dust electrostatically flock together, and gravity takes over coalescing grains into rocks. Those rocks become boulders, then asteroids colliding again and again, striking planets and each other.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Sun
programme.desc: The sun bathes our planet in warmth and light. It powers the machinery of nature, our weather, and it encourages and sustains life on land and at sea. We study it closely, and it can reveal the secrets of all other stars.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Moons of Olympus
programme.desc: There are many more worlds in our solar system than just the planets. The mysterious moons of the gas giants may hold much more than we ever imagined. Each one is unique, and each one deserves a scrutinous eye.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: First Light
programme.desc: The Hubble Telescope is nearing its end, the replacements are ready to go, ready to peer further back in time and space than can be imagined.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Stars Above
programme.desc: The life cycle of stars reveal to us the past and the future of Earth and ourselves.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Dark Side
programme.desc: In terms of the Universe, we know we don't know much, especially when it comes to dark matter and dark energy. Scientists are devoting so much of their time to discovering as much as the possibly can about this mysterious matter.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Living with Space
programme.desc: Astronauts and Cosmonauts train and study for years to work and live aboard the International Space Station. With this wealth of experience and insight behind them what do they think when they return to Earth?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Atmosphere
programme.desc: Our atmosphere is an unbelievably complex machine that protects us from the vacuum of space, shelters us from harmful radiation and allows us and the biosphere to breath; we need to learn much more about it so we can better it.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Flight Status
programme.desc: The next 12 months will see an intense rise in flight tests, demonstration launches and high priority flights. Some are on time others are not. We check the flight status of some of this new hardware and these new capabilities.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Invasion Mars
programme.desc: For over 50 years we have bombarded Mars with our probes and landers. Spying from orbit to map terrain, finding her strengths and weaknesses. The time nearing for the full scale invasion of the planet- when humans walk on Mars and claim it for their own.

programme.title: Wagons East!

programme.title: Dog Whisperer

programme.title: Dog Whisperer

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: An Australian shepherd bites people and lunges at strangers since losing an eye; a hound from an animal-testing lab fears people; a Maltese shows aggressive behavior and relieves itself on the carpet.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A blue heeler/Australian shepherd mix is overprotective of his owners; a school bus severely injures an American Staffordshire terrier; finding a new companion for a French bulldog.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A blue heeler puts herself in danger chasing her owner's pickup truck; an American Eskimo/border collie mix won't walk; a golden retriever is aggressive.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A firehouse Dalmatian; a dog becomes aggressive toward his owners after being attacked by two other dogs.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A border collie/springer spaniel mix bolts toward small animals; a shepherd mix has a biting problem; a pushy poodle.

programme.desc: Basset hounds sibling rivalry; aggressive dog; possessive poodle-mix.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar helps a disrespectful yellow Lab who causes chaos everywhere she goes and some dogs who are misbehaving at the office.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A French bulldog fails the doggy day-care entrance exam; three Jack Russell terriers fight one another for their owner's attention; a beagle howls incessantly while on walks.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Problem dogs in the U.K. including two dogs that spent most of their lives in Africa, and a barking Jack Russell terrier mix.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer

programme.desc: Cesar helps the lead singer of Rooney with his aggressive pit bull, while writer and producer Paul needs help with his two Boston terriers.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Playboy Playmates, Miss February 2010 is having trouble with her Chichuahua, while Orange County, Miss September 2011 with her terrier pug mix.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar helps comedians Skyler Stone, Ralphie May and Paul Rodriguez get to grips with their unruly hounds.

programme.title: After the Wildfires
programme.desc: Charting the long-term recovery of wildlife in the aftermath of Australia's catastrophic bushfires through stories of hope, human intervention and resilience; an urgent message to safeguard the environment before it is too late.

programme.title: My Wild Cats
programme.desc: Get closer to nature and deepen your understanding of our complex natural world. Filmed in the highest quality, Love Nature offers viewers powerful stories of nature's beauty and wonder from around the globe.

programme.title: Weird, Wild & Wonderful
programme.desc: Get closer to nature and deepen your understanding of our complex natural world. Filmed in the highest quality, Love Nature offers viewers powerful stories of nature's beauty and wonder from around the globe.

programme.title: Wild Caribbean: Rhythms of Life
programme.desc: These Caribbean coasts and islands are made out of once-living creatures, and are now a labyrinth of life.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Observe the islands' natural rhythms and the challenges of bringing forth new life in this wild outpost; watch as turtles return to their nesting sites, rival iguanas butt heads to win a new mate, and albatrosses conduct sweet courtship dances.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: Meeting the innovative teams working to preserve and protect Kenya's wildlife; Save the Elephants' radio-tracking-collar system; a drone that monitors wild dog packs; a local team of Maasai cheetah trackers.

programme.title: Wild Family Ties
programme.desc: Making our first friends is something we can't forget and it's the same in the wild; discover the importance of having allies and gaining trust in the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Becoming Orangutan
programme.desc: Experiencing a roller coaster of emotions and growing pains as the sanctuary's orangutans move through six grades toward their release into the wild; Dilla's fate suddenly changes, and big boy Beni goes on an unwelcome diet.

programme.title: The Canary Islands
programme.desc: Discovering the wildlife and flora that call the Canary Islands home; how life on these remote landmasses have led to some unique evolutionary traits.

programme.title: The Great Elephant Tale
programme.desc: The Great Elephant Tale follows three stories: a calf navigates the Okavango Delta; a bull searches for a mate; and a matriarch leads her family through the desert. These individual adventures tell the story of Africa's most iconic species.

programme.title: Webs & Wings: Nature's Tiny Ballet
programme.desc: Get wowed by the pest-killing prowess hidden beneath the ladybug's cute shell.

programme.title: Under the Sea
programme.desc: Observe the risky, clever methods that marine families use to create new life.

programme.title: Wild Caribbean: Rhythms of Life
programme.desc: When volcanoes burst from the ocean, they attract unique life forms to their jungle valleys and black sandy beaches, and create deep chasms that pods of whales enjoy.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Experience the wonders of animal life in the Galapagos, where volcanoes, ocean currents and isolation shape existence; dive into mangrove forests, meet bold boobies and flightless cormorants; see Darwin's theory of evolution in action.

programme.title: Chasing the Rains
programme.desc: Anastasia's herd splits to protect two precious elephant calves; Kuleta retakes territory for her remaining cheetah cubs; Phoenix searches for a new mate; the skies open up and rain begins to heal the parched land.

programme.title: Wild Family Ties

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown

programme.title: Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/9/2023. Travelling to the mountains of Southern Mexico, Longoria discovers the hidden magic of Oaxaca that boasts some of the finest ingredients in Mexico, including chocolate, corn, tomatoes and the much-loved quesillo cheese.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/23/2023. Eva Longoria visits the state of Jalisco, where much of what is seen is quintessentially ‘Mexican’ originated. She also discovers that the state capital, Guadalajara, boasts some of the country’s most cutting-edge restaurants.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/30/2023. Eva Longoria explores the port gateway between Mexico and the rest of the world, Veracruz, and discovers that in its people remains a defiant spirit, still evident in their character, music, and the bold flavors of their food.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 3/26/2023. Mexico City is one of the world’s emerging food destinations, and it’s also Eva Longoria’s second home. Longoria takes us to some of her favorite eating spots, but in this constantly evolving city, there is always more to explore.

programme.title: Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico
programme.desc: Aired 4/2/2023. In the jungles of Yucatán State, on the eastern edge of Mexico, Longoria explores the home of the ancient Maya, where a fierce pride in that ancestry still permeates every custom and dish, even in the most innovative kitchens.

programme.title: In Harm's Way
programme.desc: Producer-director Otto Preminger’s epic treatment of the bombing of Pearl Harbor details the devastating attack on the Hawaiian naval base as well as the explosive, behind-the-scenes stories.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: When a dangerous crime wave hits the beach, Lt. Mitch Buchannon (Dwayne Johnson) leads his elite squad of badass lifeguards, including hot-shot recruit Matt Brody (Zac Efron), on a mission to prove you don't have to wear a badge to save the bay.

programme.title: Four Brothers
programme.desc: After their adoptive mother is murdered during a grocery store hold-up, the Mercer bros reunite to take the matter into their own hands. As they track down the killer, they quickly realize that their old ways of doing business have new consequences.

programme.title: Robocop
programme.desc: Detroit in the near future. A cop who dies in the line of duty is transformed into a crime-fighting cyborg by the corporation which now runs the police department. The only hitch: this "perfect" cop still seeks revenge on the creeps who mutilated him.

programme.title: Robocop 2
programme.desc: This first sequel pits Robocop against a gang of drug dealers and the title creature--a supposedly improved version of himself that has gone berserk.

programme.title: Robocop 3
programme.desc: In this second sequel to the 1987 hit, RoboCop leaves the force and joins the rebellion to battle the evil business corporation OCP, which uses a police-like group to remove the homeless people who populate the site of a future upscale development.

programme.title: Top Gun
programme.desc: Tom Cruise is superb as Maverick Mitchell, a young flyer who's out to become the best. And Kelly McGillis plays the instructor who teaches Maverick a few things you can't learn in a classroom.

programme.title: The Wolf of Wall Street
programme.desc: Sex. Money. Power. Drugs. Brace yourself for a true story from legendary filmmaker Martin Scorsese. Leonardo DiCaprio stars as a young stockbroker hungry for a life of non-stop thrills, where corruption was king and more was never enough.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: As the semifinals draw near, Bigger Brother makes its mark in the arena, as it takes on Colossus and Typhoon 2 in round one. Round two sees DisConstructor tackle Xenomorph, Hammerhead 2 and Iron-Awe 2.1.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Firestorm makes a long-awaited comeback in a battle against Daisy-Cutter, Black and Blue, and Bamm Bamm. Heat P determines the robots who will make it to the semi-finals of the seventh series.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Eight competitors compete for a spot in the next semi-final round as half are eliminated. Round 1 sees Tornado employ the use of a spinner drum to flip its opponent.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: The four victors from the round 1 semifinal compete for a place in the grand final. Round 1 sees Firestorm 5 go head-to-head with Mute, in a flipping assault.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: In the eliminating rounds, Tornado takes on Storm 2, and X-Terminator challenges Typhoon 2, in a fierce attack that takes out the disc weapon of Typhoon 2.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Challengers from more than five main competitions battle for supremacy. In a David versus Goliath battle, Dantomkia takes on the might of Behemoth in an attempt to throw it out of the arena.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: An extensive and informative dive behind-the-scenes on the House Robots. Get inside information from designer Chris Reynolds, on what goes into creating these killing machines.

programme.desc: Follow Team Chaos's journey, from humble beginnings to how they ended up building one of the most feared Robots ever to compete.

programme.title: Robot Wars

programme.title: Robot Wars

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Thermidor 2 and Kronic the Wedgehog meet again in a replay of another heat. Thermidor 2 puts up an impressive fight as it takes down every robot in its path.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Heat number 11 of the series sees controversy as T-Wrecks makes a bold move that breaks the rule about having an active weapon. Round one pits Mantis, Infernal Contraption, Bulldog Breed and Jabber against one another.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Eight robots enter the arena, including old crowd favourite, Behemoth. Heat L also features a grudge match to settle the score between Behemoth and Crushtacean.

programme.title: Robot Wars
programme.desc: Champion robot Panic Attack returns in the thirteenth heat of the series. A series 5 round is replicated as the Four Horsemen and Team Panic Attack are once again pitted against each another.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Bonds
programme.desc: Mysterious flying ninja have launched a sudden attack against the Leaf. To save their village, Naruto and his friends set out to stop this new threat.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Will of Fire
programme.desc: Four Kekkei Genkai shinobi who have been guarding the Cloud, Stone, Mist and Sand disappear without a trace. At the same time, Naruto discovers that Kakashi has left the village.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: The Lost Tower
programme.desc: The Rogue Ninja Mukade is about to be caught by Naruto, when he summons the power of an ancient underground channel of chakra. Naruto gets caught up in the chakra and is sent back in time.

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden the Movie: Blood Prison
programme.desc: Naruto's battle to reclaim his honor begins! Naruto is convicted of a serious crime he didn't commit and is sent to the inescapable prison, Hozuki Castle.

programme.title: Road to Ninja : Naruto the Movie
programme.desc: Naruto and his friends succeed in driving away the infamous Akatsuki, who have mysteriously returned from the dead, but afterwards, a strange masked figure appears before him!

programme.title: The Last: Naruto the Movie
programme.desc: The moon approaches dangerously close! Naruto, Sakura, Shikamaru, Sai and Hinata, sets out to investigate and comes upon a certain plan and its unbelievable mastermind lying in wait.

programme.title: Boruto: Naruto the Movie
programme.desc: Sasuke appears before Naruto to warn him of impending danger. An inconceivable foe lies in wait as Sasuke, the Five Kage and Boruto, charge into another dimension!

programme.title: Naruto Shippuden: The Movie
programme.desc: A long time ago, a powerful spirit drove the world to the brink of destruction. Naruto's latest mission is to protect Shion, a priestess from the Land of Ogres, whom the spirit is after.

programme.title: Fatal Fury: Legend of the Hungry Wolf
programme.desc: Terry Bogard returns from 10 years of training to avenge his father's murder by entering the King of Fighters tournament.

programme.title: The Arrival
programme.desc: Radio astronomer Zane Zaminsky believes he has picked up a cosmic noise that signals extraterrestrial intelligence. His desperate search for answers leads him to discover that aliens are already on Earth and in the process of preparing to take it over.

programme.title: Black Knight
programme.desc: When a wisecracking black hustler from South Central L.A. finds himself transported back to medieval England, he leads the overthrow of an evil king and wins the heart of a proto feminist woman.

programme.title: Escape Plan: Escape Plan
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone, Arnold Schwarzenegger, and 50 Cent star as inmates who must break out of a top secret, high-security prison in this non-stop action-thriller.

programme.title: The Son of No One
programme.desc: A rookie cop is assigned to the 118 Precinct in the same district where he grew up. The Precinct Captain starts receiving letters about two unsolved murders that happened many years ago in the housing projects when the rookie cop was just a kid.

programme.title: The Last Witch Hunter
programme.desc: The last witch hunter (Vin Diesel) is all that stands between humanity and the combined forces of the most horrifying witches in history.

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: A man discovers that he possesses the ability to instantly teleport anywhere in the world.

programme.title: Love and Honor
programme.desc: While fighting in Vietnam, Dalton hears his girlfriend has dumped him so decides to fly to get her back. AWOL from the war zone, he has seven days to get back to the US, change his girlfriend's mind and make it back to Vietnam without anyone noticing

programme.title: Noah
programme.desc: Russell Crowe stars as Noah in the timeless story of courage, sacrifice, and hope. This visually stunning, action-adventure is hailed as "one of the most unforgettable Biblical epics ever put on film." *Richard Roeper, Chicago-Sun-Times

programme.title: Runaway Jury
programme.desc: In this suspenseful thriller, a high-priced and ruthless jury "consultant" will stop at nothing to secure a verdict on an explosive trial.

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Desperate to follow in the footsteps of his absent astronaut father, 13-year-old Jimmy's dreams come true when he wins one of five opportunities to compete for a scholarship to Space Camp.

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.desc: A raven-haired enchantress, Cassie Nightingale, mysteriously moves into the local haunted mansion, 'Grey House', and seems to change her neighbors lives using a hint of magic causing many to think she’s a witch.

programme.title: Kids From Planet 62F
programme.desc: Four friends find an object with special powers that belongs to two alien kids from the planet 62F. Now they must race to get it back to its rightful owners, but NASA are on their tail and they will stop at nothing to get their hands on it.

programme.title: Slow Moe
programme.desc: When struggling baseball player Marvin finds a pair of glasses that transform him into a star player, he thinks he can't win without the glasses. But when they disappear, Marvin's teammates help him realize winning doesn't mean anything.

programme.title: Bogus
programme.desc: When 7-year-old Albert's mother is suddenly killed in an auto accident, he and his imaginary French friend "Bogus" take up residence with his no-nonsense aunt Harriet.

programme.title: George And The Dragon
programme.desc: A knight (James Purefoy, "Rome") returning from the Crusades takes on a dragon after the disappearance of the kindly Princess Lunna (Piper Perabo, "Coyote Ugly"). With Patrick Swayze.

programme.title: Mumbo Jumbo
programme.desc: Thomas Doubting stumbles upon a magical amulet which takes him on a mysterious journey to the island of Sinmouth. The locals believe he is 'Mumbo Jumbo' – an entity who will restore their fortunes and rescue the beautiful Princess Vanilla.

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: Desperate to follow in the footsteps of his absent astronaut father, 13-year-old Jimmy's dreams come true when he wins one of five opportunities to compete for a scholarship to Space Camp.

programme.title: The Wind in the Willows - Original Movie
programme.desc: Toad, Rat, Mole and Badger follow animal etiquette in this version of Kenneth Grahame's classic, in stop-motion model animation.

programme.title: The Simple Life of Noah Dearborn
programme.desc: Academy Award winners Sidney Poitier and Dianne Wiest star with Mary-Louise Parker in this enchanting tale about a quiet hero who becomes the talk of the town.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Take It to the Bank
programme.desc: The Gloucester captains face a familiar decision: whether or not to take the long, high-¬-risk journey to Georges Bank to increase their chances of a big bluefin haul.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Doubling Down
programme.desc: After a massive haul offshore on Georges Bank last week, Captain Dave Carraro of FV-¬-Tuna.com and Captain TJ Ott of Hot Tuna decide to double down and make the long trip again.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Riders in the Storm
programme.desc: When a violent storm rolls in during week eleven, the Gloucester captains face a tough decision at a critical time: do they fish... or flee?

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Comeback Kid
programme.desc: With four weeks left in the season, Hard Merchandise and FV-¬- Tuna.Com struggle to stay at the top of the fleet as an unexpected adversary, the Wicked Pissah.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna Invaders
programme.desc: With only three weeks left, the North Atlantic captains face more competition than ever as boats from all over head to Gloucester and battle for those last bluefin of the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Thin Bluefin Line
programme.desc: There is a narrow margin separating the top four boats and only two weeks left in the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Final Fishdown
programme.desc: In the last week of the Atlantic bluefin tuna season, the closest race in Wicked Tuna history is a tossup among four top contenders.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Something to Prove
programme.desc: The best fishermen from Gloucester, Massachusetts, set out on the first day of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Tuna and Tequila
programme.desc: It's week two of the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season and Erin & Sarah, the father/daughter fishing operation from Portland, Maine, try to keep their lead over the Gloucester fleet.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: May the Fish Be with You
programme.desc: It's week three of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season, one captain is forced to choose between two friends on the water.
programme.sub-title: May the Fish Be with You

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: It's week four of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and tensions start to boil for Wicked Pissah's new crew, while two rival harpoon boats face off.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Big Hauls and Downfalls
programme.desc: It's week five of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season and teamwork is the name of the game for Gloucester fleet.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Help Wanted
programme.desc: Sharks, shorts and crew problems plague the fleet, but two captains get blessed with new mates while harpoon boats battle for the last fish of their season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Snitches Get Fishes
programme.desc: Midway through the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season, a long-­-running feud lands one Gloucester captain in hot water, while another boat struggles to keep their crew intact.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Opposites Distract
programme.desc: At the halfway mark of the North Atlantic bluefin tuna season some teams are working well together and killing it while others are floundering and on the verge of killing each other.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Take It to the Bank
programme.desc: The Gloucester captains face a familiar decision: whether or not to take the long, high-¬-risk journey to Georges Bank to increase their chances of a big bluefin haul.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Doubling Down
programme.desc: After a massive haul offshore on Georges Bank last week, Captain Dave Carraro of FV-¬-Tuna.com and Captain TJ Ott of Hot Tuna decide to double down and make the long trip again.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Riders in the Storm
programme.desc: When a violent storm rolls in during week eleven, the Gloucester captains face a tough decision at a critical time: do they fish... or flee?

programme.desc: With four weeks left in the season, Hard Merchandise and FV-¬- Tuna.Com struggle to stay at the top of the fleet as an unexpected adversary, the Wicked Pissah.

programme.title: The Fifth Estate
programme.desc: The top-notch team of hosts Bob McKeown, Gillian Findlay, Mark Kelley and Habiba Nosheen provides unique and engaging documentaries from Canada and beyond. "The Fifth Estate" is a reference to the term Fourth Estate, and was chosen to highlight the program's determination to go beyond everyday news into original journalism. The series has won numerous awards for its reporting, including Gemini Awards, International Emmys, the Michener Award, and even an Academy Award for a 1981 episode that was released in theaters the following year. Since September 1975, Canadians have tuned in to experience interesting stories that are always well-crafted and thought-provoking.

programme.title: White Lions: Born Wild
programme.sub-title: White Lions: Born Wild - Episode 2: Fight for Survival
programme.desc: ‘White Lions – Born Wild’ is a true wildlife story, with strong characters and closely studied behaviour. We follow the cubs’ progress as they embark on the pathway to adulthood, learning to hunt, learning to avoid danger, learning to live in their white coats. This is a strong behaviour-led film, a coming-of-age story of a very rare and unusual pair of lions. Through their eyes, we learn what it is really like to be a lion in Africa.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Iceland
programme.desc: Iceland, the island of longing in the North. The biggest volcanic island in the world is known for its grandiose landscape, for its geysers and glaciers. But it is even more famous for its horses. Icelandic horses are considered the liveliest horses in the whole of Europe with the greatest stamina. They tölt over mossy banks and lava rock unfazed by rivers, glaciers and scree slopes. In Nordic mythology the steed are never far behind the warriors. Where would Siefgried be without his horse Grani, or Odin without Sleipnir. Even the sun wouldn’t rise or set if “awake early” and “very quick” weren’t pulling their chariot. From the beginning of colonisation, the Icelanders had the kind of close relationship with their horses usually only seen among the horse-riding peoples of Central Asia. And something of this love for horses still exists today. Life without horses would be unthinkable for Haukur Goroarsson, too. The 34-year old lives with his family in Vatnsdalur, a fertile valley in the North four hours by car from the capital city, Reykjavik. For him Icelandic horses are “a sort of Viking on four legs”. The settlement of this inhospitable island on the Arctic Circle would not have been possible without the animals. The stone deserts in the country’s interior are too vast to be crossed on foot.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - India
programme.desc: Proud elegance, silky-shiny coats and a graceful, powerful physique – the supreme Marwari horses have been worshipped in India as magical creatures for thousands of years. People say they descended directly from the Gods, that once when the Gods were sitting round the fire, there was so much soot that one of the Gods had to cry. One of the tears from his right eye changed into a stallion, and one of his tears from the left eye produced a mare. Ever since, the people in Rajasthan have believed that horses are Gods. Maharaja – palaces, temples and citadels, women in colourful saris and men with bright turbans – the land of the Rajas, the king’s sons, arouse fantasies reminiscent of One Thousand and One Nights. Lively trading and war-related incidents from the past have led to the emergence of a unique horse culture in the region: Marwaris are the proud horses of the Indian Rajas. Each year in November, the small, barren desert oasis of Pushkar is transformed into a place of pilgrimage for millions of Indians. Everybody who is anybody on the horse scene in Rajasthan - Maharajas, breeders and horse masters - meets at the Pushkar Mela, the turbulent market for over 50,000 horses and camels. Pushkar is the place where the legendary Marwaris are bought and sold.

programme.title: Under the Spell of Horses
programme.sub-title: Under the Spell of the Horses - Morocco
programme.desc: Once a year the royal city of Meknes is transformed into an oriental camp. Two thousand curious onlookers gather round the square. More than five hundred riders are expected to take part in this major Fantasia, a warlike display of horsemanship. 56-year old Lachsen Slimani is also obsessed with riding games. He lives with his family on a remote highland plateau in the Middle Atlas. Lachsen is proud because his 18-year old son Mohammed wants to follow in his father’s footsteps. For that he needs his own horse, so the tradition goes. Lachsen wants to fulfil this dream for his son. So, in order to get the money together for the horse, he takes off on an adventure and is travelling to Quarzazate, which is also called the Hollywood of the desert.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: Wild Moments: Four Seasons - Spring & Summer
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. In Japan the first picnics at the cherry blossom festival kick off the long-awaited outdoor season, while the Scots perform their Highland Games. In the summer the Latvians celebrate the biggest party of the year: midsummer night. The vast wildflower meadows provide them with wreathes of flowers which have magical healing powers; animals are provided with an abundance of insects. This enables the rare hoopoe to breed in Latvia. In the Spree forest region, an enchanting river landscape south-east of Berlin, farmers still harvest the famous Spreeforest Cucumber. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a visual journey around the globe meeting people who are passionate and dedicated at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.desc: In accordance with the seasons and with deep respect of nature, people all over the world celebrate their long-standing traditions. Near the outermost border of Europe, in Bashkiria, generations of bee keepers have collected honey from rare wild bees, the Burzyan bees. In Japan the last of the Usho catch fish with "living fishing rods": trained cormorants. Traditionally, they provided the Emperor's family with fresh fish. In Poland carp are fished from the ponds to provide everybody with carp for Christmas dinner - this is an old Polish tradition. In Frisia winter is driven out by fires at what is known as "Biikebrennen", and in Hungary the "Busho" - frightening characters wearing wooden masks - do a similar job. "Four seasons - Many traditions" is a journey, meeting people who are passionate at keeping old traditions alive.

programme.title: mareTV: The Blue and White Island World of Greece: Mykonos, Naxos and Tinos
programme.desc: Around the once sacred Isle of Delos, some 200 islands, including 20 larger ones, are arranged almost in a circle. This is where the name of the Greek island paradise comes from: Cyclades, a derivation of the Greek word kýklos, circle. Each cyclade has a unique character. The pelican Petros, about 20 years old, is the mascot of Mykonos. He moves from taverna to taverna all day long, scrounging fish. This works out sometimes well and sometimes not so well. Petros does have a few human friends who regularly slip him something, but all too often visitors eager to take pictures block his path. Then he has to "wiggle" his way through the crowd. Jackie Onassis is said to have once brought Petros' "great-grandmother" from Louisiana to the island.

programme.title: Sri Lanka - Tropics, temples and tea plantations
programme.desc: Sri Lanka stands for colourful diversity in all respects. If it's spirituality or Ayurveda you're looking for, here it is. Adventurers and nature lovers can also satisfy their needs here. No one must travel far to discover exotic worlds on this drop-shaped tropical island. "mareTV" delves into the day to day lives of the is-landers, some of whom pursue the most unusual pro-fessions: Uditha Lakmaal is a palm tree climber. He harvests the sap of the trees, known as palm wine, by climbing to the top of them. Sri Lankan stilt fishermen now actually have very little to do with fish and func-tion more as models receiving payment from tourists for acting the part. Anulawathie runs a small floating hoop business, offering car inner tubes for adults and tuk-tuk tubes for children. Different varieties of tea can be found on Herman Gunaratnes tea plantation. Just four carefully selected women are allowed to harvest the exclusive white tea grown there. Each tea leaf is cut individually from the bush by gloved hands and with golden scissors.

programme.title: The Seychelles - Africa with South Seas ambience
programme.desc: The 115 islands and islets that make up the Seychelles present a breath-taking variety of plants, rare animals and beaches laced with palms. This is where the leg-endary Coco de Mer palm nuts grow with fruits weigh-ing up to 20 kilos and giant wild land turtles nibble away at mangrove fruits to their hearts content. The archipelago was first settled at the end of the 18th cen-tury. Today, a very colourful potpourri of peoples in this dwarf state proves just how peacefully different cultures can live side by side. Three times a week, the steamer "MV Espoir" completes the trip from the main island of Mahé to Praslin and back. A ship for every-one and practically everything: Used cars, toilet paper, horses, bicycles, furniture - you name it, the Espoir transports goods of all kinds. Coconuts sometimes pose a problem as there are far too many of them. What to do with them? The best place to send them is undoubt-edly Hubert Roumien's Virgin Coconut Oil Laboratory, hidden away in the Mahé jungle. Straw turns into gold at Seaweed Seychelles! There, Benjamin Port Louis collects seaweed and extracts liquid fertiliser from it.

programme.title: Cuba to Go
programme.desc: Ever since the embargo was lifted in the summer of 2015, Cuba’s popularity has been steadily increasing.

programme.title: Cuba to Go
programme.desc: Ever since the embargo was lifted in the summer of 2015, Cuba’s popularity has been steadily increasing.

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: England: The Pilgrim's Way to Canterbury
programme.desc: In the Middle Ages, the horrifying murder of Archbishop Thomas Becket of Canterbury led thousands of pilgrims to the south of England. Centuries later, the long-forgotten Pilgrims' Way is now enjoying a revival. The Pilgrims Way leads east to west cross-country from Winchester to Canterbury through the counties of Hampshire, Surrey and Kent.

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: France: The Mont-Saint-Michel Way
programme.desc: In honour of the Archangel Michael, thousands of medieval Christians set off on pilgrimages to the famous mountain monastery of the Mont-Saint-Michel in the Atlantic Ocean. Today it continues to enchant millions of visitors each year. But the pilgrimage route from Rouen to the mountain abbey seems to have been forgotten: it leads through the depths of Normandy into rural France.

programme.title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes
programme.sub-title: Europe`s Forgotten Pilgrim Routes: Switzerland, Italy: The VIA FRANCIGENA to Rome
programme.desc: For centuries, pilgrims have set off on the Via Francigena in the hopes of reaching the tombs of the apostles Peter and Paul in Rome. The ancient pilgrimage route leads through the imposing Alps to the Great St Bernard Pass and from there cross-country through Italy.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The Parque Nacional Peneda-Gerês is the only national park in Portugal. An area of almost 700 square kilometers, located in the extreme north of Portugal. Barren and rocky ridges in the plateaus, contrast with large forests and lush ground vegetation in deep valleys, crossed by lakes and rivers. The park is known for its oak forests, which are predominantly pedunculate and Pyrenean oaks. Among the typical animals of the park are the small Garrano ponies, a very old breed of horse and the only one in Europe that still lives in the wild.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The highest mountain range in Portugal is the Serra da Estrela. The episode embarks on a voyage of discovery to adventurous rock formations and villages steeped in tradition. The nature park is the largest protected area on the Iberian peninsula. In the mountain range we accompany the young scientist Ana Matos, who wants to breathe new life into old traditions, and cheese maker Maria Natália Lopes. She watches over more than 350 sheeps.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.sub-title: South West Portugal: Alentejano and Costa Vicentina
programme.desc: In the southwest of Portugal lies the little known Parque Natural do Sudoeste Alentejano e Costa Vicentina. It encompasses a narrow coastal strip that runs along the coast to the south of Portugal. Sparsely populated, this coastal region, which was placed under protection in 1988, is considered one of the last intact ecosystems in Europe. The steep cliffs, the almost constant wind and high waves have ensured that mass tourism has not gained a foothold here. There are still near-natural forests and a diverse bird life.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: Madeira - Portugal's autonomous island in the Atlantic Ocean, is closer to the African coast than to the mother country Portugal, from which it is separated by about 900 kilometers. The island's name comes from Portuguese sailors who claimed the uninhabited isle for themselves in 1419. Madeira means wood and that was available in abundance. Almost the entire surface was covered by dense forest. Since 1982, two-thirds of the landscape has been protected.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The "Parque Natural da Ria Formosa" is one of the largest lagoon conservation areas in Europe. Bordered by five natural islands. A mosaic of sandbanks, brackish and freshwater lagoons and salt marshes. In 2010, the "Ria Formosa" was chosen as one of the seven natural wonders of Portugal. It is a unique ecosystem: in the winter months, more than 20,000 birds gather here. In addition, the nature park has one of the largest seahorse populations internationally. More than half of all fish species in the Atlantic are said to spawn in the lagoon.

programme.title: The Turkish Riviera - The flair of antiquity and a turquoise sea
programme.desc: With a coastline boasting miles of bathing beaches, turquoise waters, breath-taking cliffs whilst being steeped in history, the Turkish riviera was even a fa-vourite of the Ancient Greeks, Romans and Ottomans, who all loved the mild climate and the lush landscape. Near the ruins of the ancient city of Side, Menderes Akdemir works on the latest attraction aimed at Riviera holidaymakers: his spooky pirate ship "Big Kral" is due to leave dry dock and head for the sea. Mehmet Özata came up with a very clever idea: to be able to cope with the basically ruinous puffer fish plague along the coastline, he produces a selection of leather utensils made of their skin. The islands that surround the sunk-en city of Simena are hugely popular, despite the very modest infrastructure and lack of shopping facilities. This is why Fatma and Ahmet Mazili have transformed their small rowing boat into a floating snack bar. An-other gap in the market was brought to life by Ufuk Secgin. He came up with the idea of providing Halal Holidays, vacations that conform to Islam. For Muslims to be able to relax on holiday, much has to be well organised, with a copy of the Koran and a prayer rug seen as the absolute minimum requirements
